item.title: Switch 2 worldwide sales top 17.37 million, Switch tops 155.37 million
item.content:encoded:
• Switch
  • Switch 2

7.01 million Switch 2 units sold in the three months ended December 31, 2025.

Nintendo Switch 2 has sold 17.37 million units and Switch has sold 155.37 million units worldwide as of December 31, 2025, Nintendo announced in its latest earnings release. Switch has now outsold DS, which sold 154.02 million units, and has become Nintendo’s best selling hardware to date.

A total of 7.01 million Switch 2 hardware and 17.31 million software were sold during the three months ended December 31, 2025, while a total of 1.36 million Switch hardware and 47.37 million software were sold.

Nintendo also shared updated sales numbers for its first-party Switch 2 and Switch titles.

The 10 best-selling first-party titles are:

Switch 2

  1. Mario Kart World – 14.03 million
  2. Donkey Kong Bananza – 4.25 million
  3. Pokemon Legends: Z-A – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition – 3.89 million
  4. Kirby Air Riders – 1.76 million

Switch

  1. Mario Kart 8 Deluxe – 70.59 million
  2. Animal Crossing: New Horizons – 49.32 million
  3. Super Smash Bros. Ultimate – 37.44 million
  4. The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild – 33.64 million
  5. Super Mario Odyssey – 30.27 million
  6. Pokemon Scarlet / Pokemon Violet – 28.08 million
  7. Pokemon Sword / Pokemon Shield – 27.08 million
  8. The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom – 22.40 million
  9. Super Mario Party – 21.28 million
  10. New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe – 18.80 million

Newly announced additional first-party sales numbers include:

  • Nintendo Switch Sports – 17.84 million
  • Super Mario Bros. Wonder – 17.15 million
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree – 9.41 million
  • Pokemon Legends: Z-A (Switch) – 8.41 million
  • Super Mario Galaxy (Switch) – 2.28 million
  • Super Mario Galaxy 2 (Switch) – 2.24 million

More than 37.93 million Switch 2 games and 1,500.16 million Switch games have been sold worldwide.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/switch-2-worldwide-sales-top-17-37-million-switch-tops-155-37-million

item.title: A-Train9 Evolution announced for Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

A-Train series' 40th anniversary title due out on June 4 in Japan.

Artdink Corporation has announced A-Train9 Evolution for Switch 2. It is the official 40th anniversary title of the A-Train simulation game, railroad management, and urban development series, which began in 1985. It will launch on June 4 in Japan. It will only support Japanese.

The game will be available in the following editions:

  • Standard Edition (physical / digital) – 11,800 yen (12,980 yen with tax)
    • A copy of the game (physical edition is a game-key card)
  • 40th Anniversary Memorial Box (physical) – 14,800 yen (16,280 yen with tax)
    • A copy of the game (game-key card)
    • LOGiN & Weekly Famitsu A-Train 40th Anniversary Edition (B5 size, 56 pages)
    • A-Train 40th Anniversary pin badge
    • A-Train 40th Anniversary special commemorative ticket sheet (hard ticket)

Here is an overview of the game, via its official website:

About

The evolved scenery depicts a new city.

The railroad connects cities and transports people. In connected cities, people gather, and the cities grow even larger… In A-Train 9, you can realistically experience the joy of urban development.

A-Train 9 Evolution is not a mere port of A-Train 9—the user interface and graphics have been completely revamped. Furthermore, the addition of new buildings, including greenery-covered buildings, allows for modern urban vistas.

Key Features

  • New Vistas – Reworked lighting and reflection effects create even more realistic vistas. Cloud shadows fall across the city, and richer water depiction brings a sense of a breathing city that changes over time.
  • A Wealth of Cityscapes – Reflecting changes in society, the cityscapes of A-Train 9 Evolution have evolved to feel more modern. The game includes numerous facilities designed with accessibility and convenience in mind, as well as many greenery-covered buildings, allowing you to create a new era of urban cityscapes.
  • Isometric View Mode – The series’ familiar isometric view mode returns. You can change the viewing angle in 15-degree increments, allowing you to play with the same perspectives as classic A-Train titles such as A-Train 3, A-Train 4, and A-Train 7. Enjoy the detailed cityscapes of A-Train 9 Evolution in an approachable isometric view.

Watch the announcement teaser trailer below.

Announce Teaser Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/a-train9-evolution-announced-for-switch-2

item.title: Azure Striker Gunvolt Trilogy Enhanced ‘CONNECT iX’ Copen mode update now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch

Speed through five stages and bosses as Copen.

Inti Creates has released an update for Azure Striker Gunvolt Trilogy Enhanced that adds the new “CONNECT iX” mode to Azure Striker Gunvolt 3, in which Copen from Gunvolt Chronicles: Luminous Avenger iX 2 is playable.

Here are the details:

“CONNECT iX” Brings Copen to Azure Striker Gunvolt 3 for the First Time

One hero CONNECTS across the borderline. A new mode, “CONNECT iX (Speedrun),” has been added to Azure Striker Gunvolt 3. In CONNECT iX, players will control Copen from Gunvolt Chronicles: Luminous Avenger iX 2 as he speeds through five stages and bosses, attempting to get the highest score in the shortest time.

  • Use the Bullit Dash to speed through the air, lock onto enemies and take them down.
  • The seven EX Weapons (Lola’s special equipment) from Gunvolt Chronicles: Luminous Avenger iX 2 to unlock new strategies!
  • Enter Overdrive mode when your Kudos are high enough. Copen will power up, Lola will transform and support you with her song. (Keep gaining Kudos and she might transform into something new!)
  • Credits dropped by enemies can activate Lola’s Healing skill. Save them up for tough encounters.

Master this customized Copen in “CONNECT iX (Speedrun)” to achieve higher and higher scores!

About Azure Striker Gunvolt Trilogy Enhanced

Azure Striker Gunvolt Trilogy Enhanced is a collection of three traditional 2D action platformers, Azure Striker Gunvolt (2014), Azure Striker Gunvolt 2 (2016), and Azure Striker Gunvolt 3 (2022) together in one release, complete with all downloadable content.

The Azure Striker Gunvolt series boasts a rich story, played out with real-time dialog during missions, and a vast catalog of music, with over 37 songs performed by the games’ characters.

This special Trilogy also comes with exclusive features: action revisions from the series director, revised voices and songs, and formerly Japan-exclusive voiced stories included in the game. This collection is the complete and definitive way to experience the acclaimed 2D action trilogy

Azure Striker Gunvolt Trilogy Enhanced is available now for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

CONNECT iX Mode Trailer

Screenshots

  • ❮
  • ❯


https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/azure-striker-gunvolt-trilogy-enhanced-connect-ix-copen-mode-update-now-available

item.title: Neverness to Everness ‘Prologue Gameplay’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5

"Co-Ex Test" runs from February 6 to 20.

Publisher Perfect World Games and developer Hotta Studio have released a 12-minute “Prologue Gameplay” trailer for free-to-play urban open-world action RPG Neverness to Everness ahead of its closed “Co-Ex Test” set to run from February 6 to 20.

As previously announced, the test will be available across PlayStation 5, PC, iOS, and Android. It will support English, Japanese, Korean, Traditional Chinese, Simplified Chinese, French, German, Spanish, and Russian language options, with English, Japanese, Korean, and Chinese voice-overs. The storyline for will cover up to the episode, “Deal? Deal!”

Neverness to Everness will be available for PlayStation 5, PC, iOS, and Android. A release date has yet to be announced.

Watch the trailer below.

Prologue Gameplay Trailer

English

Japanese

Korean

item.title: Prize Fighter: Heavyweight Edition launches February 20
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5

Full-motion video game remaster dated.

Full-motion video game remaster Prize Fighter: Heavyweight Edition will launch for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam on February 20, developer Screaming Villains announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via PlayStation Store:

Originally developed by Digital Pictures, Prize Fighter returns!

Prize Fighter: Heavyweight Edition takes you closer than a ringside seat—it puts you right in the game. In this remastered Digital Pictures classic, you’re the one slugging it out with the best boxers in the world.

With your fists in view, you can throw any punch, anytime. A jab. A hook. An uppercut! Land a blow and watch your opponent reel.

When you take a punch, your vision rocks. You might even find yourself flat on your back, looking up into the faces of the referee and your trainer as you take the count. Or maybe you’ll be up there accepting the heavyweight crown!

You’re fighting in the main event, attended by your trainer, cornerman and bucket boy. They guide you, help you, give advice. Also on hand: the referee, card girls, announcer, assorted hecklers, and four of the beefiest, brawniest, pug-ugly opponents you can imagine.

Prize Fighter is brooding, brutal, real! In fact, the bouts are staged by Ron Stein, the boxing guru who choreographed the fight scenes in Raging Bull and the Rocky films. Close-ups, point of view shots and handheld camera bring the intensity of the boxing scene right in your face!

Rebuilt from the ground up, Prize Fighter has been enhanced with 4K video along with numerous improvements and new features!

So pull on your gloves and get ready for tonight’s main event. You’ve got to beat three tough contenders to earn your shot at the champ.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/prize-fighter-heavyweight-edition-launches-february-20
